text: this isn't the set for a slick
late-night talk show or an Oprah Winfrey
special although the designers
commissioned to turn a Tampa Florida
hockey arena into a nationally televised
political convention have constructed
both Republican presidential candidate
Mitt Romney's image makers know he has
been perceived as stiff and distant they
are determined to use the convention to
display his warmer side on prime-time
every aspect of the architecture of the
2012 Republican National Convention has
been carefully crafted to feel nothing
like a convention at all in fact much of
the team drafted to design the event
come from outside the political world
the 2.5 million dollar Frank Lloyd
Wright inspired theatrical stage is
meant to convey warm approachability and
openness there are two musical stages
one for surprise musical acts and
another for a house band the podium will
be decked by 13 different video screens
to show biographical videos and images
of mr. Romney's family all the screens
will be framed in dark wood to give the
sense of looking into someone's living
room 39 million people are expected to
tune in to the convention mr. Romney's
advisors are hoping that the meticulous
planning that has gone into the entire
production will help alter the
candidates image
you
